gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 11,16]]Jesus said to the crowds: â€œTo what shall I compare this generation? It is like children who sit in marketplaces and call to one another,
[[Mt 11,17]]'We played the flute for you, but you did not dance, we sang a dirge but you did not mourn.'
[[Mt 11,18]]For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they said, 'He is possessed by a demon.'
[[Mt 11,19]]The Son of Man came eating and drinking and they said, 'Look, he is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners.' But wisdom is vindicated by her works."

first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 1,1]]Blessed the man who follows not 
the counsel of the wicked 
Nor walks in the way of sinners, 
nor sits in the company of the insolent,
[[Ps 1,2]]But delights in the law of the LORD 
and meditates on his law day and night.

[[Ps 1,3]]He is like a tree 
planted near running water, 
that yields its fruit in due season, 
and whose leaves never fade. 
Whatever he does, prospers.

[[Ps 1,4]]Not so, the wicked, not so; 
they are like chaff which the wind drives away.
[[Ps 1,6]]For the LORD watches over the way of the just,
but the way of the wicked vanishes.
